Hello all,

I saw some messages about financial prediction methods using NE=
AT and
I simply wonder if someone get interesting results using these techn=
iques.

In fact, I already read a paper about exchanging rates where the
au=
thors used neural networks to try to perform better than classical
techniqu=
es but the results seemed to be mitigated (ref : Christian L.
Dunis and Mar=
k Williams, Modeling and Trading the EUR/USD Exchange
Rate: Do Neural Netwo=
rk Models Perform Better ?).

Basically, I suppose that NEAT could be appli=
ed with success to this
kind of supervised learning, starting from a lot of=
 historic data and
then using backpropagation to determine the weights of t=
he network.

Of course, due to the evolving structure of the networks produ=
ced by
NEAT, each network will have to be trained using a training data set=

(with backpropagation technique) and then validated using the
validating d=
ata set, thus providing a fitness measure. The networks
who perform better =
will be selected for the next generation and so on.

Of course, speciation,=
 complexification and structure flexibility will
be used.

Any comments wil=
l be welcome,

Best regards,

Sam
